CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 28, 1957, page 2, reads: "Jim-Crow Chow? - Marjorie Dow (third from right) and Mrs. McInerney Woodson charge, before Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald (seated, second from left) that Sam Ung (second from right), owner of the Tea garden in Homewood, discriminated against them in refusing them seats in a vacant booth. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Atty. Zeno Fritz, Tea Garden owner Sam Ung, Marjorie Dow, and Mrs. McInerney Woodson taking oath before Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald in discrimination case
